de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.sortable

Interface SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>

  • Type Parameters:
    GroupType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's group items
    ChildType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's child items
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, NoChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SelectableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEnableStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractExpandableListAdapter, AbstractFilterableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSelectableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter, ExpandableListAdapterImplementation, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation

    public interface SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    Defines the interface, an adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a sortable list of arbitrary group and child items, must implement. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a ExpandableListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Detail

      • sortGroups

        void sortGroups()
        Sorts the adapter's group items in an ascending order. If the underlying data of the adapter's group items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.

      • sortGroups

        void sortGroups(@NonNull
                Order order)
        Sorts the adapter's group items in a specific order. If the underlying data of the adapter's group items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the group items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • sortGroups

        void sortGroups(@NonNull
                java.util.Comparator<GroupType> comparator)
        Sorts the adapter's group items in an ascending order, by using a comparator.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the group items, as an instance of the type Comparator. The comparator may not be null

      • sortGroups

        void sortGroups(@NonNull
                Order order,
                @NonNull
                java.util.Comparator<GroupType> comparator)
        Sorts the adapter's group items in a specific order, by using a comparator.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the group items, as an instance of the type Comparator. The comparator may not be null
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the group items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • getGroupOrder

        Order getGroupOrder()
        Returns the current order of the adapter's group items.
        Returns:
        The current order of the adapter's group items as a value of the enum Order or null, if the adapter's group items have not been sorted yet or if the adapter's underlying data has been changed since it has been sorted the last time. If not null, the order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • sortChildren

        void sortChildren()
        Sorts all of the adapter's child items in an ascending order. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.

      • sortChildren

        void sortChildren(@NonNull
                  Order order)
        Sorts all of the adapter's child items in a specific order. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the child items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • sortChildren

        void sortChildren(@NonNull
                  java.util.Comparator<ChildType> comparator)
        Sorts all of the adapter's child items in an ascending order, by using a comparator.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the child items, as an instance of the type Comparator. The comparator may not be null

      • sortChildren

        void sortChildren(@NonNull
                  Order order,
                  @NonNull
                  java.util.Comparator<ChildType> comparator)
        Sorts all of the adapter's child items in a specific order, by using a comparator.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the child items, as an instance of the type Comparator. The comparator may not be null
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the child items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • sortChildren

        void sortChildren(int groupIndex)
        Sorts the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index, in an ascending order. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, whose child items should be sorted, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

      • sortChildren

        void sortChildren(int groupIndex,
                  @NonNull
                  Order order)
        Sorts child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index, in a specific order. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, whose child items should be sorted, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the child items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • sortChildren

        void sortChildren(int groupIndex,
                  @NonNull
                  java.util.Comparator<ChildType> comparator)
        Sorts the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index, in an ascending order, by using a comparator.

        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the child items, as an instance of the type Comparator. The comparator may not be null

      • sortChildren

        void sortChildren(int groupIndex,
                  @NonNull
                  Order order,
                  @NonNull
                  java.util.Comparator<ChildType> comparator)
        Sorts the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index, in a specific order, by using a comparator.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, whose child items should be sorted, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the child items, as an instance of the type Comparator. The comparator may not be null
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the child items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • sortChildren

        void sortChildren(@NonNull
                  GroupType group)
        Sorts the child items of a specific group in an ascending order. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, whose child items should be sorted, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown

      • sortChildren

        void sortChildren(@NonNull
                  GroupType group,
                  @NonNull
                  Order order)
        Sorts child items of a specific group in a specific order. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, whose child items should be sorted, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the child items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • sortChildren

        void sortChildren(@NonNull
                  GroupType group,
                  @NonNull
                  java.util.Comparator<ChildType> comparator)
        Sorts the child items of a specific group in an ascending order, by using a comparator.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, whose child items should be sorted, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the child items, as an instance of the type Comparator. The comparator may not be null

      • sortChildren

        void sortChildren(@NonNull
                  GroupType group,
                  @NonNull
                  Order order,
                  @NonNull
                  java.util.Comparator<ChildType> comparator)
        Sorts the child items of a specific group in a specific order, by using a comparator.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, whose child items should be sorted, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the child items, as an instance of the type Comparator. The comparator may not be null
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the child items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • getChildOrder

        Order getChildOrder()
        Returns the current order of all child items, regardless of the group they belong to.
        Returns:
        The current order of the child items as a value of the enum Order or null, if not all child items have been sorted yet or if the adapter's underlying data has been changed since it has been sorted the last time. If not null, the order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • getChildOrder

        Order getChildOrder(@NonNull
                    GroupType group)
        Returns the current order of the child items of a specific group.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the children, whose order should be returned, belong to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The current order of the child items, which belong to the given group, as a value of the enum Order or null, if the child items have not been sorted yet or if the adapter's underlying data has been changed since it has been sorted the last time. If not null, the order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • getChildOrder

        Order getChildOrder(int groupIndex)
        Returns the current order of the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the children, whose order should be returned, belong to, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The current order of the child items, which belong to the given group, as a value of the enum Order or null, if the child items have not been sorted yet or if the adapter's underlying data has been changed since it has been sorted the last time. If not null, the order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • addSortingListener

        void addSortingListener(@NonNull
                        ExpandableListSortingListener<GroupType,ChildType> listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been sorted.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the class ExpandableListSortingListener. The listener may not be null

      • removeSortingListener

        void removeSortingListener(@NonNull
                           ExpandableListSortingListener<GroupType,ChildType> listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been sorted, anymore.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the class ExpandableListSortingListener. The listener may not be null
